description: Hartlepool fall to a 1-0 defeat against Dover in their first clash after being relegated from the Football League last season.
title: Hartlepool United 0-1 Dover Athletic
title_page: Hartlepool United 0-1 Dover Athletic - BBC Sport
maintext:
Hartlepool fell to a 1-0 defeat against Dover in their first clash after being relegated from the Football League last season.
New Pools boss Matthew Bates saw his side struggle to take control early on, with a half chance for Padraig Amond all they had to show for the first 25 minutes at Victoria Park.
Dover, who are adjusting to life without 40-goal marksman Ricky Miller, then took the lead after 29 minutes through debutant Jamie Allen. The ex-Southport striker turned sharply to find space in the box and curl home amid a scramble from a corner.
Amond continued to threaten for the hosts, but Kane Richards missed a gilt-edged chance to put the visitors 2-0 up after 55 minutes and then Ryan Bird headed just wide in the closing moments to leave Pools in no doubt that getting back up will not be easy.
